oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Markets and Institutional Capacity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ingemann, Jan Holm
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
Policy environments and social economy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Adequate explanations concerning the introduction of production and consumption of organic food in Denmark imply the necessity to engage a certain understanding of markets. Markets should subsequently not be seen as entities nor places but as complex relations between human actors. Further, the establishment, maintenance and development of markets are depending on the capacity of the actors to enter into continuous and enhancing interplay.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Ingemann, Jan Holm (2010) Markets and Institutional Capacity. ICROFS News, 2010, 2010 (4), pp. 7-8.
